data.event: MOSCOW — Russia’s membership in the Council of Europe is not threatened by sanctions, despite Moscow’s continued refusal to ratify two key human rights protocols, two of the council’s top politicians said Wednesday.
It is important that Russia is not marginalized,” van den Brande told reporters after two days of talks with government officials and Duma deputies.
“It has many shortcomings and won’t lead to real reform,” he said late Tuesday, Interfax reported.
